doc.wiki: A metadata registry is a central location in an organization where metadata definitions are stored and maintained in a controlled method. A metadata repository is the database where metadata is stored. The registry also adds relationships with related metadata types. Metadata registries are used whenever data must be used consistently within an organization or group of organizations.
